Pre-Game Insights: Moldova performed fairly well in the previous edition of the Nations League, winning four of their six group games but ultimately missed out on promotion due to goal difference.
Malta have endured a poor run of form in recent games and will be desperate to turn a corner when they return to competitive action this weekend.
Others: Moldova were thrashed 4-0 by Ukraine in their most recent outing, conceding twice in either half as they fell to their heaviest defeat since 2022.

Malta were beaten 2-0 by Greece in their last match, conceding both goals in the opening 15 minutes and failing to offer a response in an overall disappointing performance at the Untersberg-Arena in Austria.
The hosts are undefeated in their last five games in this fixture, a run stretching back to February 2004.
The visitors have managed just one clean sheet in their last eight games across all competitions.
The Tricolours were ranked 152nd in the latest FIFA rankings and now sit 20 places above their weekend opponents.
